title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2 ADO: QUALITY JUSTICE SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, the justice for children mechanisms offer timely, quality and comprehensive justice services for all adolescent girls and boys, including the most deprived, and young people have the opportunity to participate in decisions affecting their lives., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Disaster Risk Reduction. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent boys and girls, especially the most deprived, live free from violence, have capability to reach their full potential and contribute to a cohesive and resilient society.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the justice for children mechanisms offer timely, quality and comprehensive justice services for all adolescent girls and boys, including the most deprived, and young people have the opportunity to participate in decisions affecting their lives.

description.narrative: Justice for Children continues to be a priority action area of the Government of Sri Lanka, which led to milestone legislative measures and interventions aimed at providing quality justice services for adolescent girls and boys. UNICEF is specifically advocating to increase the minimum age of labour to 16, for which cabinet approval has been given. Moreover, with UNICEF's support, the Attorney General's Department has successfully brought down the backlog of child abuse cases from 12,000 to 800, whilst simultaneously attending to new cases. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: National normative framework exits to enable diversion of children in conflict with law

target.value: 2020:Functional multi-sectoral committee established¿to prevent violence against children under the National Child Protection Committee

title.narrative: Existence of a strengthened system for adolescent participation

baseline.value: Score 1 (There is limited system for adolescent participation. The system does not have more than 2 of the key elements listed in Score 4)

target.value: 2020:Score 1 - The draft roadmap towards adolescent participation developed. This roadmap will identify existing platforms and entry points across sectors all levels to institutionalize adolescent participation.

actual.value: 2020:ToR finalized and the process to recruit a national consultant has been initiated.

title.narrative: Police Women and Children desks operate according to Child and Women friendly guidelines

baseline.value: Score 1: Child and women friendly police guideline is available

target.value: 2020:Score 2: Guidelines are translated into Tamil and Sinhala (National) languages

actual.value: 2019:Guidelines for the operation of Police Women and Children's Desks are available and translated into national languages.
